messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Candice about my English
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/18/101 2:43:53 PM EST, Mactier@bigfoot.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/18/101 2:43:53 PM EST, Mactier@... writes:

<<
Thanks for your wonderful post on socialisation. (s in SA z in US)
>>
I find this kind of funny because I read a lot of Harlequin romances from the
UK as a young girl and to this day I spell words like "socialisation" with an
"s" instead of a "z".
Amy in Ohio

messages.subject: Candice about my English
messages.msgSnippet: Hey, I m from South Africa. Guess you talk about cans of food in US?? Our spelling is quite different from your - we go British - but chances are I mispelled
messages.messageBody:
Hey, I'm from South Africa. Guess you talk about cans of food in US?? Our
spelling is quite different from your - we go British - but chances are I
mispelled too. English is my second language and far from perfect.

Thanks for your wonderful post on socialisation. (s in SA z in US)

Take care

Dalene
